author: Special Correspondent
text:
A gang beat up a 32-year-old man and drowned him in the Tamirabharani near Veeravanallur on Saturday evening.

Police said that S. Marimuthu of Mayilapuram under Pettai police station limits, who was working as a driver in Chennai, had come to his native place a couple of days ago to offer worship in a temple near Veeravanallur.

When he was going to the temple on Saturday evening, a gang, including Udhayakanth (32) and Parthiban (23) from Pattanmedu village, intercepted him and picked a heated argument with him after asking him about his native place.

When the gang members attacked Marimuthu, he ran away from them. However, the gang caught him after a hot chase, and drowned him in the Tamirabharani.

As Marimuthu failed to return home on Sunday morning, his relatives started searching for him and found his body lying on the banks of the river near Thenthirupuvanam Sastha Temple.

Veeravanallur police have registered a case. Further investigations are on.
title: Youth beaten up, drowned in Tamirabharani
